json.text:
So I play all these FPS games and, no,
I've never actually shot a real gun.
I shot a, a World War II pistol, that my grandfather had. I shot it one time.

I don't really consider that counting 'cuz,
one shot, that's it. So no, not really.

On stage yes, everything else that kind
of comes with it, like online matches

and all the practice that I did...
Not so much, no.

Yeah, probably definitely, because it's
honestly everything I wanted to do.

I started as a streamer, and then I went to a pro, 
and now I'm back as a streamer.
So, yeah, it's the best decision I've ever done.

What has to be in my fridge? 
Uh, Madrinas, for sure, a hundred percent.
Maybe some, uh, creamer for my hot coffee, all I need.

My dream team for any Battle Royale is 
my team that I always have.

Which is me, Chad, Justin,
and the newcomer, ChocoTaco.

He's you know, I met him through 
streaming and he owns.
They love it, honestly, they've never, they've never hated me gaming, they actually loved me gaming always.
'Cuz it kept me out of trouble, you know.
My favorite food in Cali is

DEFINITELY, a hundred percent, everyone
knows this, California burrito, Cali B. Mmm!

Not really, the second I moved here,
like three years ago in California.

The weather's great, the food's great,
I don't think I want to move anywhere else.
I went to a dog beach one time, with, with Troy.  But, besides that... it's actually the only time I've gone to the beach.
Oh, what's my music playlist name?

For my stream, very simple, I got rock,
and then I got troll, and then I got random.
Those are my three.

Part of the routine is watching "The Office"
every night before bed.

I've seen it about eight times, and
I have about an hour to two hours

after my stream, to watch something else, 
new show? No, "Office" all the time.
Oooh, is a hot dog sandwich? Yes, I always say yes.  My stream actually likes that question, and I say yes.

There's no reasoning, it's just a sandwich,
and you've gotta listen to me.
One word to describe me?  "Chill", I think my stream would probably describe me as "chill".

Because for the most part when I'm
fraggin', I'm chillin'.
I have my moments where I rage a little bit.
I'm chill.

This is a Polish eagle, and I got it from my 
grandfather before he passed away.
He gave it to me and I've just been wearing it ever since.

Like, I love the Fallout series, I would say those are 
my favorite series.
Fallout 3, Fallout New Vegas, Fallout 4 was okay.

I would say funniest stream donation that 
I got, it kind of turned into a meme.

I even made a shirt about it. When I was playing in a
tournament, I had text-to-speech on and I do,

still to this day, and I just got a donation that said,
"Word on the street is..."

And it just made me laugh, and then another 
person donated, then another person,
and it went on for hours and hours, just kept,

it didn't stop, and then the next day
I got more, the next day I got more.

Even to this day, like, three months later
it's still happening, and it still makes me laugh.
My favorite thing that my chat spams the most is, personally, my "ShroudW" face.
That's, that's my go-to, I love it.

Best is that he's like really, really chill for 
my favorite type of breed.
My favorite type of breed is Husky.

He's a mix, Husky/German Shepherd, 
so, he's really chill for his breed.
Worst, is that he's still a puppy.  Because puppies are just rowdy, they bite and all that.
But once he's full-grown, it's gonna be great.

The best ones by far, I think have 
been in the music section.

So, I gave a shout-out to a drummer, and 
then he was playing like
some of my favorite bands and stuff on the drums and everything.
Another one, I hosted a singer, and she made like an album now, so she's doing really, really well.

And she made a song about me and
everything, so, I'd say those two for sure.

My best advice to aspiring streamers would be
pick a game that is not popular.

So don't go with the, the 
really, really popular BRs right now.

Find a game that you like that's got a smaller 
community on Twitch,
maybe like, 500 viewers to 2,000 because there's just less streamers.
There's less competition, and

especially if you really, really like
that game they're gonna love it, too.

'Cuz, people that come to a smaller section
like that know that game really, really well

and they're gonna stick around for a
while, so, that's what I would do.
